gep

Class ReproductionEnvironment

  • java.lang.Object
    • gep.ReproductionEnvironment

  • public class ReproductionEnvironment
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the reproduction environment of the GEP algorithm. It includes all genetic operators to be applied in the current run. The order of application is well defined by the order of adds to this environment. This also means that operators can be added multiple times to allow their application at different times (and after other operators).
    Author:
    Johannes Wortmann

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ReproductionEnvironment()
      Creates a new instance of a reproduction environment with an empty list of operators.
      ReproductionEnvironment(java.util.List<GeneticOperator> operators)
      Creates a new instance of a reproduction environment with a list of operators in the same order as returned by the iterator of the given list.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ReproductionEnvironment

        public ReproductionEnvironment()
        Creates a new instance of a reproduction environment with an empty list of operators.

      • ReproductionEnvironment

        public ReproductionEnvironment(java.util.List<GeneticOperator> operators)
        Creates a new instance of a reproduction environment with a list of operators in the same order as returned by the iterator of the given list.
        Parameters:
        operators - The list whose operators are to be placed into this environments list of used operators.

    • Method Detail

      • addGeneticOperator

        public void addGeneticOperator(GeneticOperator op)
        Adds the given genetic operator to the reproduction environment. This means the genetic operator will be applied during the reproduction phase of GEP. The order of the operators is determined by calls to this function. This means that the order of the operators is the same as the order of calls to this function.
        Parameters:
        op - The genetic operator to be added

      • reproduce

        public <T> void reproduce(Individual<T>[] individuals,
                          int fromIdx)
        This method applies all genetic operators to the population defined by the given array of individuals. The order of the operators is defined by the order of calls to addGeneticOperator(GeneticOperator). All individuals with a lower index then fromIdx will be excluded from genetic operations.
        Parameters:
        individuals - The population
        fromIdx - The index in the population array from which the operators are applied.s

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
